tweets.text: .@EnvAgency Chief Exec @JamesBevanEA tells @CommonsEFRA that #StormChristoph brings 24 to 48 hours of heavy rain to ground that is already saturated. #TeamEA on the ground working with partners to prepare. Check your flood risk here: https://t.co/CnoJPZIDpY https://t.co/DD7vHRRfXh

Amber weather warning in place for Leicester, Leicestershire & Rutland. #BePrepared. @EnvAgencyMids @metoffice 

https://t.co/2OHqTTs62k

There are #FloodWarnings in place as #StormChristoph brings heavy rain across England.  

Know what to do in a flood and check your flood risk: https://t.co/MPz7Fwblnq  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/MaE7ptFod2

Flood alerts are in place for three areas of Rotherham. The Council is taking steps to protect at risk residential areas.

Follow @EnvAgency and @EnvAgencyYNE for the latest updates.

More information on our website: https://t.co/EUSqZinZO1 https://t.co/E1A5RXrCGB

We are operating flood storage basins across Lancashire including #Garstang, #Catterall and #Wigan this afternoon to take pressure away from nearby rivers.

You can check the latest river levels here: https://t.co/ci5f7Xwedm
#StormChristoph https://t.co/wzIYGZzpiF

#StormChristoph continues to bring heavy rain across England. Stay safe at home - if you need to go outside, be alert to the hidden dangers of flood water and check your flood risk at: https://t.co/xNlgwQrrt9  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/H7wc6P2CXd

Flood alerts have been sounded ‚Äì keep up to date with weather forecasts @MetOffice @metofficeNEEng and advice from @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyYNE

If you take regular medicines? Keep them close at hand in case you have to leave quickly.

See @PHE_uk advice https://t.co/hxRMEcjuze https://t.co/TUuJU4iki8

#StormChristoph: If you live near areas prone to flooding in England, you're being urged to prepare for rising water levels this week. #ukweather

https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb

tweets.text:
@EnvAgency Chief Exec @JamesBevanEA urges everyone to use the online Flood Information Service to check risk of flooding due to #StormChristoph. He asks that people stay away from swollen rivers.

https://t.co/iJprXxwlJT

Catherine Wright of the @EnvAgency asks how many Londoners know what the Thames Barrier is doing for them? "Our thinking needs to change faster than our climate is changing" @Oceanrecovery @Coastalfutures21 https://t.co/7P5Pmf2FKy

@WildStoke @SoTCityCouncil ...... and Berryhill Fields is saturated like a massive sponge at the moment, holding back rainwater & preventing flooding in lower lying areas of the city & beyond üëçüèºüåß

@sbhfag @EnvAgencyMids @StaffsWildlife

Great session at #CoastalFutures21 on #CoastalAdaptation #ClimateEmergency with Catherine Wright & Mark Garratt @EnvAgency @EG_Cunningham & Colin Scott ABPmer. Key messages: We need to: do more, change faster than climate is changing & focus on communities & people #oceanrecovery

tweets.text: Tonight @MyDoncaster we have teams deployed in anticipation of #StormChristoph. We are preparing for the worst, while hoping for the best. Please follow @metoffice @EnvAgency @mydoncaster @SYFR @syptweet for upto date info.

urls.title: Flood advice and information ‚Äì Rotherham Metropolitan Borough Council
urls.description: When there's flooding in Rotherham, we'll provide assistance, practical support and information as soon as it's safe and appropriate to do so.

tweets.text:
Flood alerts are in place for parts of South Yorks. As a precaution Rotherham Council is taking steps to protect high-risk residential areas.

Make sure you are prepared in the event of flooding and follow @EnvAgency & @EnvAgencyYNE for updates

‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/EUSqZinZO1 https://t.co/3ZlF0nZets

tweets.text: Our latest flood timeline for the next few days as #StormChristoph  arrives. It will draw moist warm air up over England for hours ahead. This is a dynamic situation so stay close for updates. Be prepared by signing up to our free flood warnings here https://t.co/gfaL38C2kU https://t.co/QSlOr7hNj1

Stay safe at home - if you need to go outside, be alert to the dangers of flood water.

üåß Never enter flood water, on foot or in a vehicle.
üì± Sign up to @EnvAgencyNW flood alerts.
üìû Call 999 if life is at risk - we‚Äôre here to help. #NotJustFires https://t.co/a4GF86dYu2
